clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) Plus Standard of Care Versus Standard of Care Only for the Treatment of COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Randomized Study of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) Plus Standard of Care Versus Standard of Care Only for the Treatment of 2019 Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Recherches Cliniques de Montreal

clinical_study.source: Institut de Recherches Cliniques de Montreal

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, randomized, multi-centre pilot study where hospitalized subjects will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio to receive Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) in addition to standard of care or standard of care only for 28 days following confirmation of a COVID-19 infection.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary purpose of this randomized study will be to evaluate the effect of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) treatment on the reduction of severe acute respiratory coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) viral titers. The secondary purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) treatment on the progression of COVID-19 disease in these subjects and their recovery. In addition, certain parameters which may help elucidate the mechanism of action (sLDLR, PCSK9, sACE2, D-dimers and CRP) will be followed. The safety of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) will be evaluated at each visit. Subjects will be randomized to receive treatment for 28 days and then will return 30 days following the discontinuation of treatment for a final safety visit.
The results of this study will be used to design an adequately powered randomized controlled pivotal study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Isoquercetin (IQC-950AN) in all or a subset of subjects with confirmed COVID-19.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in viral load from baseline to end of treatment - Mean viral load
primary_outcome.description: Viral load of SARS-CoV-2 RNA (# of viral copies) assessed by quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in viral load from baseline to end of treatment - Area under the viral load vs. time profiles
primary_outcome.description: Viral load of SARS-CoV-2 RNA (# of viral copies) assessed by quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in viral load from baseline to end of treatment - Time profiles of viral load
primary_outcome.description: Viral load of SARS-CoV-2 RNA (# of viral copies) assessed by quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in viral load from baseline to end of treatment - Time to viral negativity
primary_outcome.description: Viral load of SARS-CoV-2 RNA (# of viral copies) assessed by quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical recovery is defined as: Fever </= 36.6 degrees C Respiratory rate </= 24/minute on room air Oxygen saturation >94% on room air Cough mild or absent
If the patient required supplementary oxygen during hospitalization
If the patient required mechanical ventilation during hospitalization
If the patient was admitted to ICU
Length of time in hospital prior to being discharged

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in serum C reactive protein levels (CRP)
Changes in soluble low-density lipoprotein receptor (sLDLR) expression and proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9 (PCSK9) and soluble angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (sACE2) levels
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in sLDLR expression, and PCSK9 and sACE2 levels

arm_group.description: 1000 mg Isoquercetin b.i.d. on day 1, then 500 mg Isoquercetin b.i.d. for 27 more days, plus standard of care (as defined below)
This arm will receive standard of care based on national guidelines. This may change as new information regarding best practice emerges.

intervention.description: Isoquercetin will be administered by mouth twice daily for 28 days
